channel.title: Help With Something
channel.description:
Ok, let's say i was going to run 2 run.bats how could i edit where the character saves are going EX. im running a server on 5555 and one on 43594 how would i log out of the 5555 one and the char file would save into the file then log into the 43594 one and have the same stuff? basically how could i edit the area the server saves/loads the character files?
thanks.

item.title: Help With Something
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

easier said than done trust me… it keeps having problems loading…

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Something
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Just make both servers save to 1 file, and keep that file on your desktop.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Something
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

Guys ok listen i got two folders this is what it goes to when it saves…&…Loads…

try { characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./LMFAO!!!/"+ playerName + ".txt")); charFileFound = true; } catch (FileNotFoundException fileex1) { }

Heres the char file…

C:\Documents and Settings\Josh\Desktop\Joshscape\characters

i tried putting the above code there gave me a bunch of errors not: i suck at this stuff…

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Something
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:4, topic:233761”]ooh, i see. well. you could find where it is loading the saved files from. And then change that to the full path.[/quote]Pretty much what blitz said. Just make two character folders and name them differently. so whenever their is a save that links the the path of a char foler, make two different saves for each port.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Something
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

ooh, i see. well. you could find where it is loading the saved files from. And then change that to the full path.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Something
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

i know what you mean but you can run two servers on the same ports i need to amke them save and load from the same folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Something
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Just copy the source, then edit it. then run the run.bat from the copyed sources.

Read full topic
